metadata.title: CVE-2019-3821 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way civetweb frontend was handling requests forceph RGW server with SSL enabled. An unauthenticated attacker could createmultiple connections to ceph RADOS gateway to exhaust file descriptors forceph-radosgw service resulting in a remote denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3821` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-common - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-fs-common - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-fuse - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-mds - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-resource-agents - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-test - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcephfs-java - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcephfs-jni - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcephfs1 - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
librados2 - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libradosstriper1 - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
librbd1 - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
librgw2 - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-ceph - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-cephfs - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-rados - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-rbd - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
radosgw - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
rbd-fuse - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
rbd-mirror - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
rbd-nbd - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
